review_title: A great organization for mission driven people
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: This organization has a fantastic mission and really does the work. It's incredibly effective at its job and there are opportunities to contribute beyond your job description. The benefits are more generous than many other non profits and the salaries are very high compared to similar titles in other organizations. We get an excessive amount of paid time off (vacation, holidays, office closures, sick leave) which is not common across these professions. This is a very diverse group of people and there are affinity groups that contribute to conversations along different identity lines. This organization also seems very stable and adequately funded which is rare in the non profit world.
cons: There is a lot of work here and people work long hours. Sometimes it's hard to take advantage of the paid leave because there is so much to do. There are some long-standing employee morale problems and the new leadership has not been able to shake some issues from the past. There is a lack of consistency in management; some managers are very details oriented and quality focused and some managers only demand the bare minimum.

review_title: Great Mission but Internal Culture Needs Work
pros: Great mission that motivates staff. I have built some of the most meaningful relationships with my colleagues who are amazing at their jobs. Great benefits which include transit benefits, 401k contribution match, FSA's, Health, Dental, Vision.
cons:
A severe divide between senior leadership and staff. There is a lack of trust since all senior leadership is new. A continued cycle of senior leadership asking for staff feedback and disregarding it. When actual issues are brought forth by staff, leadership is either dismissive or tries to placate staff.

Human Resources, along with other departments are understaffed and the hiring process is glacial. 
Equity and other DEI buzzwords are thrown around to placate staff. 
Staff feels burned out. 
A concentrated effort to force people to return to the office despite staff requesting and advocating for a flexible work from home options.

pros:
Great place to work and I enjoy my role within the organization.
There is pay transparency, I believe our salaries are higher than the market average, rigorous hiring process which allows for the best employees to join us, internal DEI committee is staffed by employees from all departments, this allows for representation from all levels and across the organization which is important, there are many opportunities for feedback on policies, practices, benefits. There may be some bad experiences with some people but I wouldn't say it speaks for the entire organization.
cons: I am not sure if this is a con, but certain bad experiences (that happen in all organizations) are sometimes treated like its everyones experience. My experience has been great and I look forward to continuing the work for IP.

pros: Passionate individuals working together towards the most meaningful cause
cons: Really can't think of anything...

pros: Helping people in a meaningful way
cons:
Nonprofit burnout
Low salary 
Not much flexibility

pros: Great mission. Everyone behind it.
cons: Limited growth and career opportunities.

pros: Incredible experience working with brilliant and passionate attorneys to get wrongfully convicted people exonerated
cons: I only wish the organization were bigger and could do what we do in an even larger capacity!

pros: Growing up, I always heard the phrase: "Find a job you enjoy doing, and you will never have to work a day in your life." Since being employed at the Innocence Project, this saying has become my reality. Every day, I am amazed by my co-workers and the meaningful work we come together to do.
cons: More resources to support employees as they perform emotionally tolling work.

review_title: Better than anywhere else I've worked
pros: Passionate and smart coworkers, salary transparency, great benefits, good work-life balance, communicative leadership, and fulfilling work. By far the most functional nonprofit that I am familiar with.
cons: It would be neat to collaborate more with other departments.

pros: Benefits & working with clients. You'll meet lifelong friends.
cons: But you'll meet those lifelong friends as you commiserate together. If you are BIPOC or hold any other marginalized identity, this is a really difficult place to work. There is very little or no internal growth for BIPOC in the organization. Extraordinary toxic attorney affinity culture and the elitism is so real, especially in the hiring process. There is NO process for inclusive engagement. Very hierarchal institution.

pros: Solid pay and benefits package. Important mission.
cons: Highly dysfunctional internal culture. Lack of vision, transparency, communication, accountability, integrity, and respect on the part of senior leadership. Significant organizational bloat. Unethical fundraising and communications practices.

pros: They provide decent benefits. There is new leadership for the first time in over a decade.
cons: Repeated pattern of internal conflict and racial inequity. Microaggressions abound. Very little possibility of internal growth and promotion. Severe deficiency in people management. Several managers care more about raising their own profile and less on developing and managing their team. Internal culture is toxic and steeped in hierarchy.

pros: the work is very impactful
cons: there is a lot of turnover

review_title: Solid Work Place, Good Work Environment
pros: Fun, smart co-workers and interesting work
cons: Internal politics get in the way of the overarching progress of the organization

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Excellent benefits package. Competitive pay.
cons: Racism is endemic. Extremely hierarchical. Leadership micromanages, lacks transparency, and gets defensive about feedback.

pros: The mission and the clients are incredible.
cons: Many people in the organization are racist or racially insensitive at best.

job_title: Communications Associate in New York, NY
pros: Overall it is a good company to work for .
cons: Working hard to be diverse and inclusive.

pros: Colleagues, Location, What we do, Mission, Vision
cons: Emotions re: what we're dealing with

pros: Well run non-profit that literally saves people's lives. Every victory we had, I felt like I was contributing to making life better for the wrongfully convicted. They do an amazing job connecting all the staff to the clients so you can really experience their struggles and victories. HR got 1000% better during the time I was there.
cons:
While I was there, a client we KNEW was innocent was executed. That messed me up for a long time.

For some reason, the intake staff are chronically upset with their jobs. I would go for a job in ANY department except Intake.

Not a big enough organization for a lot of promotion. Definitely need to go out to move up. But working there for a while will get you noticed when it's time to go.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros:
A truly well run not-for-profit.  The company understands that workers need to have benefits, support, and community to do emotionally challenging work.

I have worked a great many places and I have never been a healthier, more collegial, challenging, stimulating work environment in my life.  It is a truly diverse organization that values difference as a central tenet towards fulfilling its mission.  To that end, people of color are at every level of the organization as are women.  The LGBT community is highly represented.  

There is a level of care and compassion and decency as well as thorough competence that I have never experienced.  It is a pleasure to be an employee at this organization.
cons: The technical / IT side of things could be stronger.

review_title: My experience was very fulfilling, informative, and provided excellent hands on experience.
pros:
Work with case files
Work independently or in a group
No micro-managing
Lots of cases and different issues
Make decisions about moving forward
Learn investigation skills
Learn a lot of Courts, DAs, PDS, and the justice system
Learn how to organize and manage a case file
Get to tour local max security prison
Meet and Interview clients in prison
Learn about false Identifications, DNA, Finger Print Evidence and other Forensics
cons:
No real permanent positions
No real pay
No actual growth within the project

review_title: Amazing Mission and Great Place to Work
pros: People are passionate about the mission. Employees are, for the most part, collegial and happy to be there. Great benefits.
cons: Pay could be higher (though it is, of course, a non-profit). Does not do merit increases -- across the board raises instead, which are pretty small.

pros: Staff are really dedicated to the mission. Leadership respects employees and the human resources team has worked hard to create an inclusive and nurturing environment where employees can do their best work.
cons: Some employees feel it's hierarchical.

review_title: Close knit team passionately dedicated to seeking justice for the wrongfully convicted.
pros: Collaborative environment amongst the attorneys. The organization approaches cases individually while simultaneously tackling policy reform to address the underlying causes of wrongful convictions.
cons: There is a well established legal team in place and so seeking employment as a staff attorney would be challenging.

pros: I loved interning her for a semester. Helping people has a nice feel to it.
cons: Not all that organized to be honest. But they try.

pros: Supportive team, clear and concrete tasks, good balance between being able to work independently and under guided supervision.
cons: Stipend should be more generous.

pros: Great place to start learning about wrongful conviction work.
cons: With limited resources, an organization can only do so much

pros:
Great mission
Lots of vacation days
cons:
Very low salary for non-management
No professional development
Work culture isn't great

pros: Supportive co-workers, collaborative work environment, impactful work.
cons: There are no cons here.

pros: Don’t do it. Run away
cons: Racist organization. Stay away. For real.
